title: 'We're praying everyone's safe': Mako Vunipola reveals England team's family fears as Typhoon Hagibis strikes Tokyo
text:
England prop Mako Vunipola spoke for the rugby world when he expressed his fears for the safety of his family and everyone in Tokyo as Japan waits to assess the damage left by Typhoon Hagibis.

At least one person has died and millions of people have been ordered to evacuate as Japan Meteorological Agency issued its highest emergency warning. Typhoon Hagibis, which is generating gusts of up to 145mph, is the most powerful storm to have hit Japan in 60 years.

With the worst of the super typhoon due to strike Tokyo overnight, World Rugby will begin an inspection of the Yokohama Stadium at 6am on Sunday to assess whether the crucial Japan v Scotland match can go ahead. A final decision is expected...
description: England prop Mako Vunipola spoke for the rugby world when he expressed his fears for the safety of his family and everyone in Tokyo as Japan waits to assess the damage left by Typhoon Hagibis.
